monitor module¶

Main classes for running the canPDOMonitor

Monitor routes datapoints from a pdo_converter to attached dataloggers, managing the stopping and starting of each. Can use a CAN_SYS_PDO.order object dictionary to choose PDO format

class monitor.Calibrate(name, offset=0, gain=1, new_name=None, keep=False)¶

Bases: monitor.FilterType

” Defines an offset and gain to be applied to the named signal

Create a new signal by giving a new_name, keep the old one as well by setting keep to True

Parameters

  • name (String) – Name of signal to act on

  • offset (Float) – Offset applied to signal before gain

  • gain (Float) – Gain applied to signal after offset

  • new_name (String) – Name of new signal. If None, signal value replaced

  • keep (Bool) – If True, creates a new signal with name new_name

process(datapoints)¶
class monitor.FilterType¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Base class for Filter

Child classes must implement the process method that acts on a list of datapoints, can change values, add more etc

abstract process(datapoints)¶
exception monitor.InvalidArgumentsError¶

Bases: Exception

class monitor.Monitor(device=None, format=None, pdo_converter=None)¶

Bases: object

Routes datapoints from the pdo_converter to any attached dataloggers

Typical usage: Optionally include a Device, leave format and pdo_converter blank. Format will then include the PDO specifications from the CAN_SYS_PDO.odr file in the current directory

Parameters

  • device (can.Device) – Defaults to virtual.Virtual, with its defaults

  • format (can.Format) – Defaults to object dict in local directory, then class default for can.Format

  • pdo_converter (can.PDOConverter) – Defaults to PDOConverter with device and format given in the constructor

add_datalogger(datalogger)¶

Adds a datalogger to the monitor

Parameters

datalogger (datalog.DataLogger) –

add_filter(filter)¶

Add filter to be applied in between the pdo converter and logger/graphs

filter is one the classes deriving from FilterType base class

Parameters

filter (FilterType) – A filter to be applied the datapoints

start()¶

Starts the pdo converter and begins routing data to loggers

This must be called after all the dataloggers are added

stop()¶

Stops the monitor and all attached items

Calling this should successfully end all threads in PDOConverter, Device and all dataloggers
